intro: Stanmarkia spectabilis, commonly known as the showy starflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 12 to 24 inches, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Stanmarkia spectabilis prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sun, making it a suitable addition to native gardens and wetland habitats.
